intro: Ipomoea hassleriana f. sinuatolobata, commonly known as the Sinuate-lobed Morning Glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, lobed leaves and trumpet-shaped, violet or blue flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant is a climbing vine with tendrils that allow it to攀援 on supports. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Convolvulaceae family.
